An immediate recommendation! If you have not read this book I highly recommend reading it. I read this book in my AP English class when I was in high school and I don‚Äôt think a single person in that class would have criticism on this masterpiece of a book.

Beautifully written and a great story teller. The relationships in the book were problematic and I find myself disconnecting near the end because of it. 
#TheirEyesWereWatchingGodBook

Happy new week everyone.  Here is what am reading this week....Their Eyes Were Watching God by Zora Neale Hurston, One Hundred Years of Solitude by Gabriel Garcia Marquez which am buddy reading and Hood Feminism by Nikki Kendall because #nonfictionnovember

What book(s ) are you reading this week?

I finally read this entire book all the way through! Throughout my life I‚Äôve read excerpts for school and started it and stopped but I read the entire thing and finished last night.

I have thoughts.

ZNH‚Äôs writing is phenomenal, as always. She is a master with words and I love how she uses language and Deep South dialect with her characters.

I love how every character is nuanced, deeply flawed and real. This is a simple story but it is human and relatable and lovely.

My biggest issue with this book is that it sort of devolved into a Jim Crow version of Twilight when Janie met Tea Cake. I know some people might fight be on this but I found Tea Cake and Janie‚Äôs relationship almost distractingly toxic. Janie went from a powerful, outspoken, ambitious woman to a flat, sad, doormat before Tea Cake. And I also sort of thought Tea Cake was the worst too. I just never warmed to him. ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

I still recommend this book, though. It is REALLY beautiful.
